alert.note: Alert for Stillwater (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 23 at 7:21PM MDT until June 23 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected to continue through early Saturday morning. * WHERE...A portion of south central Montana, including the following county, Stillwater. * WHEN...Until 800 AM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 717 PM MDT, Emergency Management reported flooding in and around Absarokee this evening. Doppler radar indicated between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen in the warned area since this afternoon. While the rainfall rates have tapered off over the past few hours and flash flooding is no longer a threat, additional rainfall is expected overnight. This will keep flooding ongoing until runoff has had a chance to recede. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Grove Creek, Fishtail Creek, Orson Coulee, Stillwater River, Trout Creek, West Antelope Creek, West Rosebud Creek, Butcher Creek, Beaver Creek, Rosebud Creek, South Fork Grove Creek, Whitebird Creek, East Rosebud Creek, Jack Stone Creek, Cow Creek, Spring Creek and Davidson Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Absarokee and Fishtail. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
